content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graphs of the functions <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown above on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 5"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graphs consist of line segments, except where <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction with numerator 5 times the sine of open parenthesis, pi x, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 minus, 2 times x cubed, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Write a difference quotient that best approximates the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 4.5"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graphs of the functions <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown above on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 5"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graphs consist of line segments, except where <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction with numerator 5 times the sine of open parenthesis, pi x, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 minus, 2 times x cubed, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Write a difference quotient that best approximates the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 4.5"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Let <math alttext="h of x, equals, g of open parenthesis, f of x, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, h of x"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use correct limit notation in your answer.

(c) Let <math alttext="k of x, equals, f of x, plus, g of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Consider <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="x equals 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 4"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. At which one of these values does <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a jump discontinuity? Justify your answer for the jump discontinuity using correct limit notation.

(d) Values of <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table below. What type of discontinuity does <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Based on the values in the table, what is a reasonable estimate for <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x "><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Give a reason for your answer. <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 11 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 0.995. f of x is 2.631. Column 2. x is 0.996. f of x is 2.628. Column 3. x is 0.997. f of x is 2.626. Column 4. x is 0.998. f of x is 2.623. Column 5. x is 0.999. f of x is 2.621. Column 6. x is 1. f of x is Undefined. Column 7. x is 1.001. f of x is 2.615. Column 8. x is 1.002. f of x is 2.613. Column 9. x is 1.003. f of x is 2.610. Column 10. x is 1.004. f of x is 2.607. Column 11. x is 1.005. f of x is 2.605."><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 5em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0.995</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.996</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.997</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.998</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.002</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.003</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.004</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.005</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mn>2.631</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>2.628</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.626</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.623</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.621</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>Undefined</mtext></mtd><mtd><mn>2.615</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.613</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.610</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.607</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.605</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 1.1: Introducing Calculus - Can Change Occur at an Instant?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
